data.enText: encourage/give help
to help or encourage sb/sth by saying or showing that you agree with them/it
to support a proposal

data.chText: 政府支持这些工会组织提出的确定最低限度工资的要求。
data.enText: The government supported the unions in their demand for a minimum wage.

data.chText: 这些措施得到环境保护组织的大力支持。
data.enText: These measures are strongly supported by environmental groups.

data.chText: 如果你在会上提出这个问题，我将支持你。
data.enText: If you raise it at the meeting, I'll support you.
to give or be ready to give help to sb if they need it

data.chText: 一个向艾滋病患者提供援助的组织
data.enText: an organization that supports people with AIDS

data.chText: 这家公司将向欧洲客户提供技术支持。
data.enText: The company will support customers in Europe (= solve their problems with a product) .
provide money, etc.
to help or encourage sth to be successful by giving it money

data.chText: 几家大公司正在对这一项目提供资助。
data.enText: Several major companies are supporting the project.
to provide everything necessary, especially money, so that sb/sth can live or exist

data.chText: 马克得扶养他第一次婚姻生的两个孩子。
data.enText: Mark has two children to support from his first marriage.

data.chText: 他为维持吸毒的恶习而走上犯罪的道路。
data.enText: He turned to crime to support his drug habit.

data.chText: 生命无法在火星的大气环境下生存。
data.enText: The atmosphere of Mars could not support life.
hold in position
to hold sb/sth in position; to prevent sb/sth from falling

data.chText: 混凝土支柱支撑的平台
data.enText: a platform supported by concrete pillars

data.chText: 你抱婴儿时要把头扶好。
data.enText: Support the baby's head when you hold it.
help prove sth
to help to show that sth is true

data.chText: 目击者的描述与证据不符。
data.enText: The witness's story was not supported by the evidence.
sports team
to like a particular sports team, watch their games, etc.
Which team do you support?
pop concert

data.chText: （在流行音乐会上）当助演，担任演出嘉宾

before.enText: of a pop band or singer

data.enText: to perform in a pop concert before the main performer

data.chText: 利物浦当地的一支乐队为他们作助兴演出。
data.enText: They were supported by a local Liverpool band.
computer

before.enText: of a computer or computer system

data.enText: to allow a particular program, language or device to be used with it

data.chText: 这台数字音频播放器支持多种格式。
data.enText: This digital audio player supports multiple formats.
encouragement/money
encouragement and help that you give to sb/sth because you approve of them and want them to be successful

data.chText: 公众大力支持这一变革。
data.enText: There is strong public support for the change.

data.chText: 我能指望你投我的票吗？
data.enText: Can I rely on your support (= will you vote for me) in the election?

data.chText: 只有几个人表示支持这一提议。
data.enText: Only a few people spoke in support of the proposal.

data.chText: 当地企业提供了财政资助。
data.enText: Local businesses have provided financial support .

data.chText: 她没有明确的生计来源。
data.enText: She has no visible means of support (= no work, income etc.) .
help
sympathy and help that you give to sb who is in a difficult or unhappy situation

data.chText: 家人和朋友给了她许多帮助。
data.enText: Her family and friends have given her lots of support.
holding in position
a thing that holds sth and prevents it from falling
The supports under the bridge were starting to bend.

data.chText: 我父亲死后，吉姆成了真正的顶梁柱。
data.enText: When my father died, Jim was a real support.
the act of holding sth firmly in position or preventing it from falling

data.chText: 我在脚踝上缠上绷带，好把它固定住。
data.enText: I wrapped a bandage around my ankle to give it some support.

data.chText: 她抓着他的胳膊，好站稳。
data.enText: She held on to his arm for support.
something you wear to hold an injured or weak part of your body firmly in position
a knee/back support
proof
evidence that helps to show that sth is true or correct

data.chText: 这些统计数字为我们的理论提供了进一步的依据。
data.enText: The statistics offer further support for our theory.
pop concert
a band or singer who performs in a pop concert before the main performer
The support (act) has yet to be confirmed.
technical help

data.chText: （公司向客户提供的）技术支持
data.enText: technical help that a company gives to customers using their computers or other products

data.chText: 我们免费提供技术支持。
data.enText: We offer free technical support .

simple_means.memory_skill: sup 下 + port 送 → 从下面送来的〔力量〕→ 支持

ex.chText: 我支持这一运动，因为我赞同它的目标。
ex.enText: I support the campaign because I agree with its aims.

ex.chText: 他只能靠微薄的收入来养家。
ex.enText: He had to support his family with his meagre income.
We will spare no pains to support you.

synonyms.bx: 含义广泛，多指在道义或物质上支持某人或某项事业。

ex.chText: 政府提供资金支持这项试验。
ex.enText: The government backed the test with money.

ex.chText: 有人怀疑叛乱有美国政府在背后支持。
ex.enText: Some suspected that the rebellion was backed by the US government.

ex.chText: 她的说法没有任何科学依据。
ex.enText: Her claims are not backed by any scientific evidence.

synonyms.bx: 尤指以金钱、影响力等对某人或某事物给予支持。

ex.chText: 维护法律是我们的责任。
ex.enText: We have a duty to uphold the law.

ex.chText: 国际捕鲸委员会投票支持禁止商业捕鲸。
ex.enText: The IWC voted to uphold the ban on commercial whaling.
The President swore to uphold the constitution.

synonyms.bx: 较正式用词，指在道义、行动等方面给予某人或某事物以支持。

tr: documentary validation
example: his documentation of the results was excellent
the strongest support for this view is the work of Jones

tr: a military operation (often involving new supplies of men and materiel) to strengthen a military force or aid in the performance of its mission
example: they called for artillery support

tr: the act of bearing the weight of or strengthening
example: he leaned against the wall for support

tr: aiding the cause or policy or interests of
example: the president no longer has the support of his own party
they developed a scheme of mutual support

tr: the activity of providing for or maintaining by supplying with money or necessities
example: his support kept the family together
they gave him emotional support during difficult times

tr: any device that bears the weight of another thing
example: there was no place to attach supports for a shelf

tr: supporting structure that holds up or provides a foundation
example: the statue stood on a marble support

tr: something providing immaterial assistance to a person or cause or interest
example: the policy found little public support
his faith was all the support he needed
the team enjoyed the support of their fans

tr: a musical part (vocal or instrumental) that supports or provides background for other musical parts
the financial means whereby one lives
example: each child was expected to pay for their keep
he applied to the state for support
he could no longer earn his own livelihood

tr: financial resources provided to make some project possible
example: the foundation provided support for the experiment

tr: establish or strengthen as with new evidence or facts
example: his story confirmed my doubts
The evidence supports the defendant

tr: put up with something or somebody unpleasant
example: I cannot bear his constant criticism
The new secretary had to endure a lot of unprofessional remarks
he learned to tolerate the heat
She stuck out two years in a miserable marriage

tr: adopt as a belief
example: I subscribe to your view on abortion

tr: argue or speak in defense of
example: She supported the motion to strike

tr: be a regular customer or client of
example: We patronize this store
Our sponsor kept our art studio going for as long as he could

tr: be the physical support of
carry the weight of
example: The beam holds up the roof
He supported me with one hand while I balanced on the beam
What's holding that mirror?

tr: play a subordinate role to (another performer)
example: Olivier supported Gielgud beautifully in the second act

tr: support materially or financially
example: he does not support his natural children
The scholarship supported me when I was in college

tr: be behind
approve of
example: He plumped for the Labor Party
I backed Kennedy in 1960

tr: give moral or psychological support, aid, or courage to
example: She supported him during the illness
Her children always backed her up

tr: support with evidence or authority or make more certain or confirm
example: The stories and claims were born out by the evidence

value.def: If you support someone or their ideas or aims, you agree with them, and perhaps help them because you want them to succeed.

example.ex: The vice president insisted that he supported the hard-working people of New York...
example.tran: 副总统坚称他支持辛勤工作的纽约人。

example.ex: The National Union of Mineworkers pressed the party to support a total ban on imported coal.
example.tran: 全国矿工工会向该政党施压，要求其同意全面禁止煤炭进口。

example.ex: The prime minister gave his full support to the government's reforms...
example.tran: 首相对政府改革予以全力支持。

example.ex: They are prepared to resort to violence in support of their beliefs.
example.tran: 他们准备诉诸暴力来捍卫自己的信仰。

value.def: If you give support to someone during a difficult or unhappy time, you are kind to them and help them.

example.ex: It was hard to come to terms with her death after all the support she gave to me and the family...
example.tran: 她曾经给予我和家人莫大的帮助，她的死讯令人难以接受。

example.ex: We hope to continue to have her close support and friendship.
example.tran: 我们希望她能继续大力支持，并能与她维持亲密友谊。

value.def: Financial support is money provided to enable an organization to continue. This money is usually provided by the government.

example.ex: ...the government's proposal to cut agricultural support by only about 15%.
example.tran: 仅削减约 15%的农业拨款的政府提案

value.def: If you support someone, you provide them with money or the things that they need.

example.ex: I have children to support, money to be earned, and a home to be maintained...
example.tran: 我要抚养孩子，挣钱养家。

example.ex: She sold everything she'd ever bought in order to support herself through art school.
example.tran: 为了供自己读完艺术学校，她把过去购置的所有东西都卖掉了。

value.def: If a fact supports a statement or a theory, it helps to show that it is true or correct.

example.ex: The Freudian theory about daughters falling in love with their father has little evidence to support it.
example.tran: 弗洛伊德关于女儿恋父的理论缺乏依据。

example.ex: The two largest powers in any system must always be major rivals. History offers some support for this view.
example.tran: 任何制度里两个最大的权力组织必定总是主要对手，这一点历史可以提供佐证。

value.def: If something supports an object, it is underneath the object and holding it up.

example.ex: ...the thick wooden posts that supported the ceiling...
example.tran: 支撑天花板的粗木柱子

example.ex: Let your baby sit on the floor propped up with plenty of cushions to support him.
example.tran: 让宝宝坐在地板上，多放几个垫子让他倚靠。

value.def: A support is a bar or other object that supports something.
If you support yourself, you prevent yourself from falling by holding onto something or by leaning on something.

example.ex: He supported himself by means of a nearby post.
Alice, very pale, was leaning against him as if for support.
example.tran: 脸色苍白的艾丽斯靠在他身上，像在寻求支撑。

value.def: If you support a sports team, you always want them to win and perhaps go regularly to their games.
At a concert or show, the support or the support act is a less well-known person or band who performs before the main person or band.
value.tran: (音乐会、演出的)助演演员，助演乐队

value.boxu_tran: 如要表达非常不喜欢或很讨厌某事物，不说 I can't support it，而说 I can't bear it 或 I can't stand it，如：She can't bear the new Labour government (她对新的工党政府非常不满)，I cannot stand going shopping (我讨厌购物)。
value.boxu_usage: If you dislike something very much or get annoyed by it, you do not say 'I can't support it'. You say 'I can't bear it' or 'I can't stand it'. She can't bear the new Labour government... I cannot stand going shopping

trans: 顾客支持；客户支持；客户服务；客户支援；客户支持部
支持价位；支撑线；支持價位
刚性支持；刚性支架；刚性支撑；刚性支护
任务支援资料；项目支持组；项目支持；支援资料的；支持方案
支援小組；中级测试工程师；支持团队；支持小组；毅行者后援团

partsOfSpeech.dec: de 去掉 + port 拿，运 → 拿出去 → 放逐
ex 出 + port 拿，运 → 运出〔港口〕→ 出口
im 进入 + port 拿，运 → 进入〔港口〕→ 进口
port 拿，运 + able 能…的 → 能拿的 → 便携式的
port 拿，运 + age 表费用；表行为或行为的结果 → 搬运；运费
port 拿，运 + er 表名词 → 搬运工
port 拿，运 + foli 树叶，引申为页 + o 表物 → 可装运书页的东西 → 文件夹
sup 下 + port 运 → 从下面运送 → 支持
trans 转移 + port 拿，运 → 从一个地方拿到另一个地方 → 运输
ap 加强 + port 部分；分开 + ion 表动作 → 把整体分开 → 分配
dis 不 + proportion 比例 + al …的 → 不成比例的
port 部分；分开 + ion 表名词 → 部分
pro 在前 + port 部分；分开 + ion 表名词 → 按之前的量分开 →〔所占〕比例

rootsaffixes.indicate: 等在同辅音词根前, 下
rootsaffixes.title: suc-, suf-, sup-

partsOfSpeech.dec: suc 下 + ceed 走 → 从下面走到上面 → 成功
suc 下 + cumb 躺 → 躺到地下 → 死亡
suf 下 + fer 带 → 带到下面 → 受苦
suf 下 + fix 固定 → 固定在〔单词〕下面〔末尾〕→ 后缀
suf 下 + fus 流 + e → 在下面流 → 弥漫
sup 下 + plant 种植 → 种在下面 → 取代
sup 下 + plic 重叠 + ant …的 →〔双膝〕一起向下 → 哀求的
sup 下 + port 送 → 从下面送来的〔力量〕→ 支持
sup 下 + pos 放 + e → 放在〔心〕下 → 推测
sup 下 + press 压 → 镇压
